jparsec.io.device.implementation

Class MeadeTelescope

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.io.device.implementation.MeadeTelescope
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GenericTelescope

    public class MeadeTelescope
extends java.lang.Object
implements GenericTelescope
    An implementation of a Meade telescope.
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Constructor Detail

      • MeadeTelescope

        public MeadeTelescope(GenericTelescope.TELESCOPE_MODEL model,
              java.lang.String port)
               throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for a Meade telescope.
        Parameters:
        model - The telescope model, must be a Meade one.
        port - The port to use, COMx in Windows and /dev/tty... in Linux. Set to null to scan for all possible ports and launch a window to select in case there's more than 1.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If no serial ports are available.

        public boolean hasGPS()
        Description copied from interface: GenericTelescope
        Checks if this telescope has GPS active or not. GPS is only available is AutoStar II models and Celestron GPS.

        Returns:

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        Description copied from interface: GenericTelescope
        Checks if this telescope is moving or not in a fast way, without sending commands to the telescope. Tracking and goto are not considered as movement here, only if the move command is called.
        Specified by:
        isMoving in interface GenericTelescope
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • move

        public boolean move(GenericTelescope.MOVE_DIRECTION direction,
           float seconds)
        Description copied from interface: GenericTelescope
        Moves the telescope in a given direction for some time. This command is unsupported in Meade LX200 and Celestron.
        Specified by:
        move in interface GenericTelescope
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction.
        seconds - The time in seconds. Must be below 10s, otherwise it will be ignored.
        Returns:
        True if the command success, false otherwise.

      • distanceToPosition

        public double distanceToPosition(LocationElement loc,
                        boolean isEquatorial)
        Description copied from interface: GenericTelescope
        Returns the distance between the current equatorial location and the input location.
        Specified by:
        distanceToPosition in interface GenericTelescope
        Parameters:
        loc - The input location.
        isEquatorial - True if input location is equatorial (RA, DEC), false if it is horizontal (azimuth, elevation).
        Returns:
        The distance in radians.

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving(float seconds,
               double tolerance)
        Description copied from interface: GenericTelescope
        Checks if this telescope is moving by comparing the position between two times. The implementation for Celestron return true/false ignoring (not requiring) any of the input parameters.
        Specified by:
        isMoving in interface GenericTelescope
        Parameters:
        seconds - Time to wait to get the position of the telescope for the 2nd time.
        tolerance - Minimum angular distance to consider that the telescope moves.
        Returns:
        True or false.

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The local time. -1 is returned if the command fails.

      • sync

        public boolean sync()
        Description copied from interface: GenericTelescope
        Synchronizes the telescope position with the coordinates of the current commanded target object. The position returned by the scope will be later referred to the target object, improving precision when measuring offsets from a given object. It is recommended to call first GenericTelescope.distanceToPosition(LocationElement, boolean) with the target position to be sure that the distance is below a given reasonably limit (1 or 2 degrees).
        Specified by:
        sync in interface GenericTelescope
        Returns:
        True if the command success, false otherwise.

        public boolean stopMoving()
        Description copied from interface: GenericTelescope
        Stops moving the scope.
        Specified by:
        stopMoving in interface GenericTelescope
        Returns:
        True if the command success, false otherwise.

        public GenericTelescope.MOUNT getMount()

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        Mount type. In case the command fails, null is returned.

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
                throws JPARSECException
        Description copied from interface: GenericTelescope
        Connects to the telescope. During initialization the connection is opened automatically, you only need to call this in case you first disconnects.
        Specified by:
        connect in interface GenericTelescope
        Returns:
        True if the command success, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs during the connection.

      • getFieldOfView

        public double getFieldOfView(int camera)
        Description copied from interface: GenericTelescope
        Returns the field of view of a camera attached to this telescope. This method returns -1 in case the field has not been set.
        Specified by:
        getFieldOfView in interface GenericTelescope
        Parameters:
        camera - The camera index, starting with 0 for the first.
        Returns:
        Field of view in radians.

      • setFieldOfView

        public void setFieldOfView(double field,
                  int camera)
        Description copied from interface: GenericTelescope
        Sets the field of view of a camera attached to this telescope. This sets the size of the mark of this telescope when showing the sky. Set the field to -1 for a default (constant) size independent of the field.
        Specified by:
        setFieldOfView in interface GenericTelescope
        Parameters:
        field - Field of view in radians.
        camera - The camera index, starting with 0 for the first.

      • setTelescopeType

        public void setTelescopeType(GenericTelescope.TELESCOPE_TYPE type)
        Description copied from interface: GenericTelescope
        Sets the telescope type. Default value is Schmidt-Cassegrain. Changing this will affect the horizontal/vertical inversion flags returned in other methods.
        Specified by:
        setTelescopeType in interface GenericTelescope
        Parameters:
        type - The goto telescope type.

      • getFitsHeader

        public ImageHeaderElement[] getFitsHeader(int cameraIndex)
        Description copied from interface: GenericTelescope
        Returns the fits header for this telescope and the last image taken with a given camera attached to it. The entries retrieved are: 
         Entry    Value (typical)   Description
 --------------------------------------
 
 BITPIX      16             Bits per data value
 NAXIS        2             Dimensionality
 NAXIS1       0             Width
 NAXIS2       0             Height
 EXTEND       T             Extension permitted
 AUTHOR       JPARSEC       Data author
 BUNIT        counts        Physical unit
 BSCALE       1.0           Data scaling factor
 BZERO       32768          (minus) data zero value
 DATE-OBS    2013-01-01 ... Date and time, usually in LT
 TIME_JD     2451545.123    Date and time as JD, in UT1
 OBS_LON     -3.4           Longitude in deg, west negative
 OBS_LAT     40.25          Latitude in deg, south negative
 OBS_NAME     Madrid        Observer name
 OBS_TZ       1             Time zone
 OBS_DST      N1            DST code
 TEL_MODE     VIRTUAL       Telescope model (driver)
 TEL_TYPE     NEWTON        Telescope type (S/C, refractor, ...)
 TELESCOP     VIRTUAL       Telescope name
 MOUNT        EQUATORIAL    Telescope mount
 CONNECT      true          Telescope connected ?
 TRACKING     true          Telescope tracking ?
 ALIGNED      true          Telescope aligned ?
 MOVING       false         Telescope moving ?
 RA           12h 00m 00s   Telescope apparent RA
 DEC          10 00' 00"   Telescope apparent DEC
 RAJ2000      12h 00m 00s   Telescope J2000 RA
 DECJ2000     10 00' 00"   Telescope J2000 DEC
 AZ           10 00' 00"   Telescope AZ
 EL           10 00' 00"   Telescope EL
 DATE0        2013-01-01 .. Date and time for the beginning of the observation
 AZ0          10 00' 00"   Telescope AZ for the beginning of the observation
 EL0          10 00' 00"   Telescope EL for the beginning of the observation
 DATE-EFF     2013-01-01 .. Date and time for the middle of the observation
 AZ-EFF       10 00' 00"   Telescope AZ for the middle of the observation
 EL-EFF       10 00' 00"   Telescope EL for the middle of the observation
 ... + camera entries ...
 FIELD        0.5           Camera field of view (deg)
 CAM_INDE     0             Camera index id value
        The values for BITPIX, NAXIS1, NAXIS2, and BZERO are later modified depending on the camera used. The values for DATE-OBS, TIME_JD, AZ, EL are for the end of the photo.
        Specified by:
        getFitsHeader in interface GenericTelescope
        Parameters:
        cameraIndex - Index for the camera, or -1 to take no camera.
        Returns:
        The set of entries for the header.
